attributes.action: Reform maternity, paternity, shared parental & adoption leave and pay
attributes.additional_details:
1) The gender pay gap is driven by women reducing time at work to care for children. Many young couples want to share work and childcare more equally but it's practically & financially difficult with the current gvt policy. Reform -> support more gender equal parenting -> enable more active fatherhood & empower women at work.
2) Birth rates are worryingly low. Urgent action is needed so young people can afford to have kids. We need well-paid parental leave & affordable early childcare for all.
attributes.background:
Simplify into a single, universal parental leave regime
Increase statutory parental pay (currently sub min wage)
Enable more gender-equal parenting by increasing leave length for fathers/partners (current paternity is 2 weeks) & requiring any employer-enhanced parental pay to be gender balanced

rejection.details: Shared parental leave allows couples to share 50 weeks of leave and up to 37 weeks of pay between them. You could start a new petition that more clearly sets out what changes you want to be made to statutory or contractual parental leave and pay entitlements.
